302.Name: DefaultReportPoint
302.Explanation: Where to report to 0=Not set, set to venue number to include in contracts

304.Name: PublicLiability
304.Explanation: If set requires Insurance upload by performers

306.Name: CSSColourDark
306.Explanation: Main Dark Contrast eg for links

313.Name: CSSColourTue, Wed, Thur, Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon
313.Explanation: Colours used for each day of programme

314.Name: CSSColourDayTabBack
314.Explanation: Used as the background for Day tables (above)

318.Name: FooterBack
318.Explanation: Background to the footer, can be colour or an image

319.Name: Procession
319.Explanation: If you want to call it a Parade, set to Parade

320.Name: MultiLimFri (Sat, Sun ...
320.Explanation: Limit dance sides to that number on that day (work in progress)

321.Name: ProcessDays
321.Explanation: Bit map of days with processions bit 1=Fri, 2=Sat, 4=Sun, 8 = Mon

322.Name: DanceNeedAddress
322.Explanation: Is the Address a Needed field

323.Name: DanceOrg
323.Explanation: Dance Organiser(s) to sign off dance emails

324.Name: DanceDefaultSlot
324.Explanation: Sub Event default size for dance

330.Name: DanceNeedPerformers
330.Explanation: If set Number of performers is checked

331.Name: DanceNeedMobile
331.Explanation: If set need a Mobile number

332.Name: DanceNeedDays
332.Explanation: If set need to select at least one day

333.Name: DanceSpecialMessage
333.Explanation: Enables a special message for Dance sides. Value: Messages Name

334.Name: DanceDefaultPerSlot
334.Explanation: Sides per sub event slot default

335.Name: AllDanceTimes
335.Explanation: If set always shows the times for each dance slot.  Not normally needed

336.Name: RestrictOneProcession
336.Explanation: If set, dance sides can only indicate one of the processions

337.Name: DanceEmailsFrom
337.Explanation: Email address Dance emails will have

448.Name: DanceFullFri, Sat, Sun, Mon
448.Explanation: If Set that day is full (Short term hack until day limits coded properly)

338.Name: SMTPuser
338.Explanation: Username for sending emails (internal never externally seen)

340.Name: SMPTserver
340.Explanation: Server to send email from (if sending via another server)

341.Name: SMTPsubdomain
341.Explanation: To add a subdomain to the mail address

344.Name: ShowYear
344.Explanation: Festival to show on public pages

345.Name: PlanYear
345.Explanation: Festival to show on staff pages

346.Name: ShortName
346.Explanation: Short acronym for festival – must be set

347.Name: FestLegalName
347.Explanation: Legal name of the festival eg Chippenham Folk Festival C.I.C.

348.Name: FestLegalAddr[]
348.Explanation: The formal address of the festival, have as entries for each line of the address as needed

351.Name: FestName
351.Explanation: Name of Festival e.g. Chippenham Folk Festival

352.Name: HostURL
352.Explanation: URL for the festival eg chippfolk.co.uk

353.Name: FestHomeName
353.Explanation: Name of the festival’s location – eg Chippenham

354.Name: EnableDateChange
354.Explanation: If you have to change date of festival, this enables the messages

355.Name: EnableCancelMsg
355.Explanation: Message to be used on a date change

357.Name: RealFaviconGeneratorKey
357.Explanation: API Key used with Real Favicon Generator

358.Name: LookBackYears
358.Explanation: Number of years to simply look back

359.Name: Camping
359.Explanation: See YearData.php to work out what it does

360.Name: FestVatNumber
360.Explanation: Vat number, if set the festival charges VAT

361.Name: VatRate
361.Explanation: VAT %age to use (if festival has a VAT Number

365.Name: InvoiceLogo
365.Explanation: Logo to be used on invoices

366.Name: FestTresEmail
366.Explanation: Email address Finance emails come from

368.Name: PerformerBanners
368.Explanation: If set, system will attempt making a banner for each side at the top of their performer public page.

369.Name: TopText4Perfs
369.Explanation: If set, the short performers description is added to a @Perf xxx tile on the front page

370.Name: DefaultPageBanner
370.Explanation: Default Banner for top of pages

371.Name: TopBannerScrollRate
371.Explanation: Scroll rate of top banner on top page (in milliseconds)

372.Name: BannerOverlay
372.Explanation: If set allows text over the banner on top page

374.Name: FoodCenter
374.Explanation: Feature number to use a the food map centre

375.Name: LinupShortDesc_Dance, _Music, _Comedy, _Family, _Youth, _Ceilidh, _Other
375.Explanation: If set show the short description of the performer on the lineup pages

377.Name: NoEventsPost
377.Explanation: Words to apply when a programme event category is not yet public

378.Name: NotAllPublic
378.Explanation: Enables “These venues have published events, more are coming” on venue list

379.Name: MainMenuTable
379.Explanation: Enables menu from database (should be always 1 now)

380.Name: Facebook
380.Explanation: Address to append to http://facebook.com/ in icon bar

381.Name: Twitter
381.Explanation: Address to append to http://X.com/ in icon bar

382.Name: Instagram
382.Explanation: Address to append to http://instagram.com/ in icon bar

383.Name: YouTube
383.Explanation: Address to append to http://YouTube.com/ in icon bar

387.Name: DefaultDirLat

388.Name: DefaultDirLong
388.Explanation: Default Long to give directions from

391.Name: GoogleAPI
391.Explanation: API used when getting directions from Google

392.Name: DirectionDefault
392.Explanation: Name of location where default directions are from

394.Name: SpecialMessage
394.Explanation: Enables a special message for non Dance sides. Value: Messages Name

395.Name: MusicTypes
395.Explanation: Enables the Type field for non-dance performers

398.Name: MusicDefaultPerSlot
398.Explanation: Performers per sub event slot default (not currently used)

399.Name: NeedBandMembers
399.Explanation: Ask for band members for music performers

402.Name: PerformerTickets
402.Explanation: How to handle them: Wimb, Chip (needs explaining)

404.Name: RecordEventChanges
404.Explanation: Record Event changes to report programme differences

405.Name: RecordPerfChanges
405.Explanation: Record Performer changes to report programme differences

406.Name: FreeText
406.Explanation: Free, Donation, what word(s) to add to an event without a price

408.Name: MailListMgrEmail
408.Explanation: Who to send emails about the mailing list to

409.Name: MailListID
409.Explanation: Mailing List ID as used by Octopus email

410.Name: PerformerPairsExtra
410.Explanation: Default pairs of performers per page

411.Name: OmitEmptyDescriptions
411.Explanation: If set Performers without descriptions will be omitted

412.Name: PaperColouredEvents
412.Explanation: Use Day Colours in printed programme

414.Name: WebSiteBanner
414.Explanation: Banner at the top of Publicity posters

416.Name: TradeEmail
416.Explanation: Email address Trade emails should come from

417.Name: TradeLastWeek
417.Explanation: Days after sending a quote before showing the “Last week message”

418.Name: TradeUnQuote
418.Explanation: Days after sending last week, before showing “UnQuote Message”

421.Name: InviteBetter
421.Explanation: Enables the “Invite Better” Message for Trade

425.Name: TradeChamberCommerce
425.Explanation: Show Chamber of Commerce Tick Box

428.Name: TradeExtras
428.Explanation: Are their Trade Extras (power, tables etc)

430.Name: TraderPasses
430.Explanation: Ask number of Trader Passes wanted

431.Name: TradeCarpark
431.Explanation: Ask number of Car park passes needed

434.Name: TradeOrg
434.Explanation: Name(s) of who is organising trade

437.Name: LogAllTrade

438.Name: AutoInvoices

441.Name: TradeArtisan
